item.description:
Hi Everyone,

I personally plan to do a simple walk here to pick out the best features on this short trail and plot what i feel is a nice walk directly to the FEATURE and skip the only woods parts for some future event.

You can join me if you want or stay home, This is something i have wanted to do for a few years and to me it seems like a good day for me to go for a walk.

OR you can stay at the shelter and start the fire..etc...

-------------------------------------

SUNDAY IS LOOKING PRETTY GOOD FOR A RELAXING DAY SO FAR.

--------------------------------------

Its just a relax in the sun and enjoy the season changing to something else.

Bring some Pot Luck Food and anything that burns for the big fireplaces at this location.

I will bring all my kayaks for the big fire, I bet the Plastic Necky Eliza will burn with an intense flame but the wooden boat will just burn slow like a cedar log..

The Eddlyliner, that's made out of ASBESTOS, it wont burn at all.

Taking bets now !

 

For current weather : http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KHFD&state=CT

Park Info: For trail maps and other stuff:

http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?A=2716&Q=325224

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Directions to Hurting Plenty State Park:

From Hartford Use apx #50 Hurd Park Road East Hampton ct for GPS and maps,

its close enough but look for the real Park Entrance nearby.

Take I -91 South to rte 9 South, (exit 22 left side on 91 S)

Take a right for the Aragooni Bridge, (rte 17/66 East direction, go over bridge and get onto rte 17 / 66), follow 17/66 (stay on 66) to Cobalt center,

Take a right onto 151 South,

Go 2.6 miles to the intersection of 151/Hog Hill Road/Hurd Park Road,

Bear right onto Hurd Park Road,

Go apx 0.75 miles then the main park entrance is on the right,

Follow the paved road apx 0.75 miles then there is a sign that says "BALL field and SHELTER" on the right,

Take that right and go to end of the twisty road to the big parking lot,

We will be at the shelter at one of the fireplaces.

See some of you soon..

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: You will see a Big Fire with many Kayaks being burned

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: *FIRE PARTY* Kayak. Season Winding Down Pot Luck Party @ Hurt Park, Cobalt CT
